newsitem.title: THAILAND: Caltex Thailand advances low-sulphur diesel sales.
newsitem.headline: Caltex Thailand advances low-sulphur diesel sales.

text.p: Caltex Oil Thailand on Tuesday launched the sale of diesel with 0.05 percent sulphur content -- two years ahead of a government deadline.
The sulphur content of the product was significantly lower than the current industry standard of 0.25 percent, a company statement said.
Thai government regulations required that vehicles use diesel with 0.05 percent of sulphur by 1999 as part of moves to reduce pollution. State-run buses started using such products from this year.

Caltex is the first oil firm in Thailand to sell 0.05 percent sulphur diesel. State-run Petroleum Authority of Thailand recently signed a deal to buy 12 million litres per month of low-sulphur diesel for government buses, starting from this month.

Caltex is a mojority shareholder of the 130,000 barrel-per-day Star Petroleum Refinery, which is the country's newest refinery and is equipped to produce low-sulphur diesel, unlike older refineries operating in Thailand.
